definition: expenditure of physical or mental effort especially when difficult or compulsory
examples: was sentenced to six months at hard labor

definition: the services performed by workers for wages as distinguished from those rendered by entrepreneurs for profits, human activity that provides the goods or services in an economy
the physical activities (such as dilation of the cervix and contraction of the uterus) involved in giving birth, the period of such labor
an economic group comprising those who do manual labor or work for wages
examples: wants the vote of labor in the elections

definition: the organizations or officials representing groups of workers
workers employed in an establishment, workers available for employment
examples: Immigrants provided a source of cheap labor.

definition: the Labour party of the United Kingdom or of another part of the Commonwealth of Nations
an act or process requiring labor : task
examples: The three-month project evolved into a year-long labor.

definition: a product of labor
examples: The flood destroyed the labor of years.

definition: to exert one's powers of body or mind especially with painful or strenuous effort : work
to move with great effort
examples: the truck labored up the hill

definition: to suffer from some disadvantage or distress
to be in the labor of giving birth
to pitch or roll heavily
to treat or work out in often laborious detail
distress, burden
to cause to labor
to spend labor on or produce by labor
to strive to effect or achieve
of or relating to labor
of, relating to, or constituting a political party held to represent the interests of workers or made up largely of organized labor groups
